symptoms.name: Nail discoloration
symptoms.pattern: May vary in color and intensity

symptoms.name: Nail thickening
symptoms.pattern: Can range from mild thickening to significant hypertrophy

symptoms.name: Nail brittleness
symptoms.pattern: Nails may become fragile and easily break

symptoms.name: Nail crumbling
symptoms.pattern: Nails may become friable and crumble

symptoms.name: Subungual debris
symptoms.pattern: Accumulation of debris under the nail plate

symptoms.name: Nail detachment
symptoms.pattern: Separation of the nail plate from the nail bed (onycholysis)

symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.pattern: May be present, especially with severe infection

symptoms.name: Discomfort
symptoms.pattern: May be present due to nail deformity or infection

symptoms.name: Foul-smelling nails
symptoms.pattern: May be present due to secondary bacterial infection

required: Clinical evaluation showing characteristic nail changes (discoloration, thickening, brittleness, crumbling, detachment)
Positive dermatophyte culture or microscopic examination of nail clippings showing fungal elements
supportive: History of exposure to risk factors
Presence of other dermatophytic infections (e.g., tinea pedis, tinea corporis)
